content.raw: This is an issue created by splitting the options by steps in argparse. Now these attributes only appear when the step is specified, meaning, in this case the options object will only have “observations” when train-run is selected. This means that when options.observations is called as before, an error would be called, since it does not exist. This was used as a workaround, returning None if the options object does not have observations. This issue is the cause for the changes to track as well.
content.html: This is an issue created by splitting the options by steps in argparse. Now these attributes only appear when the step is specified, meaning, in this case the options object will only have “observations” when train-run is selected. This means that when options.observations is called as before, an error would be called, since it does not exist. This was used as a workaround, returning None if the options object does not have observations. This issue is the cause for the changes to track as well.

content.html: How is the clobber option handled in the case of these split steps?

content.html: Why does this matter? Why is the supervision_type conditional on whether or not training is selected?

content.html: Should really give a helpful error message here. A simple warning of some sort.

update.description:
# Segway Modular API Updates

## Introduction of Steps

This introduces a new API which divides the three Segway tasks, train, identify, and posterior, into steps allowing us to stop the processes at defined intervals to view and potentially modify the input files generated by Segway before and during training. The steps that have been defined are:

* init: Generates all input files, but does not submit any jobs to GMTK \(besides triangulate\). At the end of this step the input.master, segway.str, auxillary files, tri files, and the window.bed will all be generated.
* run: Submits jobs to GMTK. Produces params and viterbi files.
* finish: Selects the best training and identify instances and uses these to generate the output files.
* train-run-round: This step is specific to training. It will run a single round of training and then stop, allowing a user to view results and modify files.

## User Interface Changes

Users wishing to run all steps of a task together may continue to do so the same way they do now, writing segway <task>. 

To run a single step, use the command segway <task>-<step>. For example, segway identify-run will run the identify associated programs. 

A change to all users will be the order of the positional arguments and additional arguments provided to segway. Now users will only be able to specify arguments specific to each task, rather than having a downstream error occur. This means that the commands must now follow the order:

`"segway [GLOBAL_OPTION] TASK [TASK_OPTION] GENOMEDATA [GENOMEDATA ...] TRAINDIR [IDENTIFYDIR]"`

Where global options are those that apply to all tasks such as cluster arguments. Task options are those that are specific to the desired task.
update.title: Split Segway Tasks into Steps

content.raw: This is so that they will run on their input.master generated from init. Otherwise the files are overwritten during the run step.
content.html: This is so that they will run on their input.master generated from init. Otherwise the files are overwritten during the run step.

content.raw:
Please clean up the `--help` interface:

```shell
$ segway --help
usage: segway [GLOBAL_OPTION] TASK [TASK_OPTION]GENOMEDATA [GENOMEDATA ...] TRAINDIR [IDENTIFYDIR]

Semi-automated genome annotation. Please see: segway TASK -h, for steps
specific to each task

positional arguments:
  {,train-init,train-run,train-finish,train-run-round,identify-init,identify-run,identify-finish,posterior-init,posterior-run,posterior-finish,train,identify,posterior,identify+posterior}
    ¦   ¦   ¦   ¦   ¦   Segway Tasks
    
...
```
content.html:
Please clean up the --help interface:

$ segway --help
usage: segway [GLOBAL_OPTION] TASK [TASK_OPTION]GENOMEDATA [GENOMEDATA ...] TRAINDIR [IDENTIFYDIR]

Semi-automated genome annotation. Please see: segway TASK -h, for steps
specific to each task

positional arguments:
  {,train-init,train-run,train-finish,train-run-round,identify-init,identify-run,identify-finish,posterior-init,posterior-run,posterior-finish,train,identify,posterior,identify+posterior}
    ¦   ¦   ¦   ¦   ¦   Segway Tasks

...

content.html: Could you please update the description to outline the steps split into, what they do, and what the overall changes are.

content.raw: I miswrote this reply, train.run and train.finish can both be set only in the case that we are running all of train. If this is the case, we don’t need to load the results from training to finish.
content.html: I miswrote this reply, train.run and train.finish can both be set only in the case that we are running all of train. If this is the case, we don’t need to load the results from training to finish.

content.raw: Yes it does mean the order needs to be perserved, this does not however change functionally from a NamedTuple. This was changed to a dictionary to match the other type dictionaries used to read and write tab files for train and identify options so they may share functions.
content.html: Yes it does mean the order needs to be perserved, this does not however change functionally from a NamedTuple. This was changed to a dictionary to match the other type dictionaries used to read and write tab files for train and identify options so they may share functions.

content.raw: This code, along with most changes to finish\_train, were moved from proc\_train\_results which performed a similar function. From my understanding, max\_params will be the training instance data from the best instance. check\_filenames will be its filenames, for the best params.params, etc. If this instance failed, no filenames would be output and present. I don’t know how this indicates all failed rather than just the best instance.
content.html: This code, along with most changes to finish_train, were moved from proc_train_results which performed a similar function. From my understanding, max_params will be the training instance data from the best instance. check_filenames will be its filenames, for the best params.params, etc. If this instance failed, no filenames would be output and present. I don’t know how this indicates all failed rather than just the best instance.

content.raw: That is correct, both can’t be done at the same time right now. Additionally, this loads the result from training and so would only ever need to run if we hadn’t just run train.run
content.html: That is correct, both can’t be done at the same time right now. Additionally, this loads the result from training and so would only ever need to run if we hadn’t just run train.run

content.raw: TRAIN\_OPTION\_TYPES is a dictionary where the keys are the names train options we need to save, values are their types for when they’re read back in. We use the keys here to know which variables need to be saved in the file.
content.html: TRAIN_OPTION_TYPES is a dictionary where the keys are the names train options we need to save, values are their types for when they’re read back in. We use the keys here to know which variables need to be saved in the file.

content.raw: This function is now used for both recovery as well as train-run-round. In that case, if this is the first round of training, as indicated by the lack of log-likelihoods, set it to -inf as it would be if the function were never called. Comment added explaining this.
content.html: This function is now used for both recovery as well as train-run-round. In that case, if this is the first round of training, as indicated by the lack of log-likelihoods, set it to -inf as it would be if the function were never called. Comment added explaining this.

content.raw: This logic was moved to the save\_gmtk\_input function. Originally this function was always called, now it is only called when SUPERVISION\_SEMISUPERVISED is true, with an assertion making sure SUPERVISION\_UNSUPERVISED is true otherwise.
content.html: This logic was moved to the save_gmtk_input function. Originally this function was always called, now it is only called when SUPERVISION_SEMISUPERVISED is true, with an assertion making sure SUPERVISION_UNSUPERVISED is true otherwise.
